required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Programmed Death-1 (PD-1) Antibody Combined With IMRT in Recurrent Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma Patients
clinical_study.official_title: PD-1 Antibody Combined With IMRT vs. IMRT in Recurrent Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma Patients: a Multi-center, Randomised Controlled, Phase III Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized controlled, phase III clinical trial. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and adverse effect of PD-1 antibody with IMRT versus IMRT alone in recurrent nasopharyngeal carcinoma patients.

primary_outcome.description: From date of randomisation to death

secondary_outcome.description: From date of randomisation to disease progression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of patients with acute toxicities
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 months
through whole study, an average of 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluating with questionnaire of EuroQoL 5 dimension, 5 level health state utility index (EQ-5D-5L)

arm_group.description: Patients randomized to this arm will receive PD-1 antibody (JS001) 240mg every three weeks during IMRT and as adjuvant therapy.
Patients randomized to this arm will receive IMRT alone.

intervention.description: Toripalimab is an antibody targeting PD-1 developed by Shanghai Junshi Biosciences Co., Ltd.

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Guangxi Medical University
The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

link.description: Home Page of Sun Yat-sen University Cancer Center
